title: Keystones are terrible for AP mids.
body:
Let's check the ferocity tree.
Heal on crit? Uh no.
Bonus damage on autoattacks? Good for Teemo and Cho, I guess?
Abilities cause a DoT that scales with AP? Nice! Oh wait, only 20% AP scaling. And less effective for AoE spells, which is what mages have.

How about the resolve tree?
A heal after 4s in combat? How would a mage ever be in combat for 4s? And the heal scales with max health, the most health an AP mid would build is {{item:3027}} {{item:3116}} ...
Bonus health from killing siege minions? That won't really matter and it will take a very long time to get the 300 hp.
Redirecting damage to yourself? We're squishy, we want to avoid taking damage. This is for the main tank.

So, the cunning tree now.
Heals and shields? We're not supports. And half of the effect is wasted because it's a solo lane.
Bonus AoE damage? Huge cooldown for the terrible base damage and AP scaling it has. And it requires hitting a full combo to proc.

There is only 1 decent keystone for AP Mids - stormraider. Good synergy with burst, helps kiting, dodging skillshots, almost guaranteed to proc if you hit a combo on a squishy, which is who you will be targeting.

For a mastery system that promised to offer tons of choices, it really failed to deliver when it comes to mages.

I don't think that any mage should be going for the Resolve tree. This tree honestly doesn't offer anything useful for mages. Back then, using 9 points on the defensive tree was possible because it didn't had any useful points for mages, but the utility tree didn't had anything useful for mages either, so the defensive tree could be taken to have the advantage on trades.

But with those new masteries, there are tons of appealing options on the cunning (utility) tree. There is no reason for mages to go with the resolve (defensive) tree.

The only exception is {{champion:8}}. He benefits very well from some resolve masteries. The tier 2 has two extremely appealing masteries for Vlad. You can either take Runic Armor, which will increase his already fantastic sustain even more, or take Veteran's Scars, which has fantastic synergy with Vlad's passive. I personally like to take Runic Armor because Vladimir already gains a lot of free HP with his passive. You can then either take Insight to reduce your summoner spells' cooldowns (good if you are going Flash/Ghost to have better mobility) or Perseverance (to have a better chance to survive the early game in which Vlad's sustain isn't so good, and also has synergy with Spirit Visage).

Not to mention, Vlad is a manaless champion. He doesn't exactly benefit from the Secret Stash mastery, and he makes very little use of Runic Afinity. Merciless and Dangerous Game are somewhat good for Vlad, but on my opinion he should just go with the masteries on the Resolve tree. He heavily benefits from them.

Not exactly. Since it is a burn effect, it actually adds 6.67% AP magic damage per second, regardless of being AoE or single target. Being AoE just makes the DoT last half as long (1.5 seconds as opposed to 3), which means that combo-ing together repeated AoE spells will still give you about the same amount of burn because there is less overlap on the burn.

Deathfire Touch *heavily* favors DPS or poke mages over burst mages because of this.

btw, i had a doubt, and you seem well-informed.
I know about how dots like deathfire touch refresh when applying it again with another skill. My doubt is about what happens if i hit a single target skill first and an aoe immediatly after: does the longer duration apply, or does the second application of deathfire touch simply replace the first one? In other words, do i get 3 seconds of deathfire touch from the first hit, or do i get only 1.5 seconds from the second hit?

I tested this on PBE a while ago.

Short answer is that the second instance of DFT will overwrite the first one.

It's a little more involved though, if you wanted to calculate it precisely. DFT "ticks" it dmg every 1/4 second. So you get 12 ticks of dmg from the single target skills and 6 from AoE/DoTs. 

So let's say you hit an enemy with a single target spell and .5s later you hit them with an aoe spell.

You'll get 2 ticks of DFT from the single target spell burn and then reapply DFT with the 10% over 1.5s

As you can imagine, this heavily favors mages that have DoTs or spammable spells. Brand is ridiculous with this mastery because every tick of his passive reapplies DFT for 4 out of 6 of its ticks. Teemo's another one that's crazy.

Anyway, this means that hitting an aoe ability right after a single target one actually makes me lose some damage from deathfire touch. So to maximize the damage i should use a single target skill last in a combo  (unless my champions have dots abilities, which works best with DTF).

Check the [devblog on masteries](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/mVU9AUuW-dev-blog-keystone-masteries-in-the-2016-season).
>So then after taking a look at the tree some of you may be thinking, “WTF MAN I PLAY AP JINX AND CLEARLY THE ONLY THING WORTH TAKING FOR ME HERE IS MASTERY X. MASTERIES DON’T MATTER! WHERE ARE MY MEANINGFUL CHOICES!?” Well... to be honest, that’s not the primary goal here. What we want is for every champion to feel like there’s a mastery path for them. More specifically, we’re hoping to draw out and amplify some of the cool things your champion’s kit does, instead of just loading on general power. 
As an example, while Janna may appreciate +10% AP, she’s going to feel much more excited about a +10% amp to shields and heals. One of these stats is for almost everyone, but the other speaks to a number of specific supports. Choice in the system is a secondary goal that, while nice to have, is not as important. There’s 126 champions out there and limited space in the tree, so we’d prefer a world where Soraka and Brand both have 1 path that speaks to them, instead of Brand getting 2 and Soraka crying in the corner. That said, giving players meaningful choices is still an important goal, so we’re trying to add it into the trees where we can. We just may not be able to do it for EVERY champion. Also looking at it in other places this preseason, like the item system. 

tl;dr:  Riot didn't promise tons of choices in masteries. They'd like multiple options, but think having at least one keystone for everyone is more important.
